FUNC.NAME: Code128securityLevel
FUNC.SYNOPSIS: is used to set the code128securityLevel which describes the Code 128 security level.

PARAM.NAME: code128securityLevel
PARAM.DESC: 0: This setting allows the scanner to operate in its most aggressive state, while providing sufficient security in decoding most 'in-spec' barcodes. 1: This setting eliminates most mis-decodes. 2: Select this option if security level 1 fails to eliminate mis-decodes. 3: Select this option if security level 1 and 2 fail to eliminate mis-decodes. Be advised that selecting level 3 is an extreme measure against mis-decoding and will significantly impair the decoding ability of the scanner.

EXAMPLE.DESC: The following example sets the code128securityLevel to level 2:
EXAMPLE.CODE: <META HTTP-Equiv="scanner" Content="allDecoders:enabled"> <META HTTP-Equiv="scanner" Content="code128securityLevel:2"> <META HTTP-Equiv="scanner" Content="enabled">

EXAMPLE.DESC: Above example can also be written as shown below:

EXAMPLE.CODE: <META HTTP-Equiv="scanner-allDecoders" Content="enabled"> <META HTTP-Equiv="scanner-code128securityLevel" Content="2"> <META HTTP-Equiv="scanner-enabled" Content="SCN1">

ADDITIONAL.APPLIES: Transient - Decoder settings are only guaranteed to persist until the Scanner is disabled
ADDITIONAL.REQ: Scanner or Imager module and device that supports code128securityLevel.
